sentences.sContent: "Then I need ask no further," said the clergyman, somewhat hastily rising from his chair.
sentences.sContent_eng: "Then I need ask no further," said the clergyman, somewhat hastily rising from his chair.
sentences.sCn: “这样看来，我就不必多问了，”牧师说着，有点匆忙地从椅子上站起身。

sentences.sContent: Yet, if the clergyman were rightly viewed, his strength seemed not of the body. It might be spiritual, and imparted to him by angelic ministrations.
sentences.sContent_eng: Yet, if the clergyman were rightly viewed, his strength seemed not of the body. It might be spiritual, and imparted to him by angelic ministrations.
sentences.sCn: 然而，如果没有看错的话，牧师的力量似乎并不在身体上，倒是在精神上，而且是由天使通过宗教仪式赋予他的。

sentences.sContent: Her spirit sank with the idea that all must have been a delusion, and that, vividly as she had dreamed it, there could be no real bond betwixt the clergyman and herself.
sentences.sContent_eng: Her spirit sank with the idea that all must have been a delusion, and that, vividly as she had dreamed it, there could be no real bond betwixt the clergyman and herself.
sentences.sCn: 她认为一切全都是一场梦幻，她虽然梦得如此真切，但在牧师和她本人之间不可能有任何真实的联系，她的精神随着这种念头而消沉了。

words.tran: 书记的；牧师的；办事员的

trans.tranOther: a male member of the clergy
